Hey there! Happy to have you on board for our masterclass :-) Today you will be learning how to prepare The Best Southern Fried Chicken. Make sure you have all the ingredients and tools and feel free to ask questions. If you are ready to start cooking simply say start.
start
Do you have any questions about the required ingredients or do you already have all you need?
I have all the ingredients but I would like to know the difference between southern fried chicken and just normal fried chicken.
Sure! Let me see what I can find

There is no difference. Southern fried chicken, also known as fried chicken, is a dish consisting of chicken pieces which have been coated in a seasoned batter and pan-fried, deep fried, or pressure fried. The breading adds a crisp coating or crust to the exterior of the chicken while retaining juices in the meat. Broiler chickens are most commonly used.

provenance.paragraph_text: Southern fried chicken, also known simply as fried chicken, is a dish consisting of chicken pieces which have been coated in a seasoned batter and pan-fried, deep fried, or pressure fried. The breading adds a crisp coating or crust to the exterior of the chicken while retaining juices in the meat. Broiler chickens are most commonly used.

provenance.page_title: The Best Buttermilk-Brined Southern Fried Chicken Recipe
provenance.section_title: The Best Buttermilk-Brined Southern Fried Chicken Recipe
provenance.paragraph_text: Fry the chicken until it’s a deep golden brown on the first side, about 6 minutes; do not move the chicken or start checking for doneness until it has fried for at least 3 minutes, or you may knock off the coating.

provenance.page_title: The Best Buttermilk-Brined Southern Fried Chicken Recipe
provenance.section_title: The Best Buttermilk-Brined Southern Fried Chicken Recipe
provenance.paragraph_text: Bake until thickest part of breast pieces registers 150°F (65.5°C) on an instant-read thermometer, and thigh/drumstick pieces register 165°F (74°C), 5 to 10 minutes; remove chicken pieces as they reach their target temperature, and transfer to a second wire rack set in a rimmed baking sheet, or a paper towel-lined plate.

Can you tell me if can substitute any of the ingredients such as the buttermilk for normal milk or if I can make my own buttermilk by adding vinegar to normal milk and if would work?
Let me see what I can find
I would actually recommend using buttermilk due to its tenderizing effects on food

provenance.page_title: The Best Southern Fried Chicken | The Food Lab
provenance.paragraph_text: Not only did the chicken come out just as moist as with water brine, it was actually significantly more tender as well, due to the tenderizing effects of buttermilk on food (soaking it for more than one night led to chicken that was so tender that it bordered on mush).

conversation.utterance: ok thanks. This was great.
That's great to hear. Let me see if I can find how to make buttermilk from normal milk.
ok thanks

So, "Acidified buttermilk" is a substitute for buttermilk made by adding a food-grade acid such as vinegar or lemon juice to milk. It can be produced by mixing 1 tablespoon of acid with 1 cup of milk and letting it sit until it curdles for about 10 minutes. Any level of fat content for the milk ingredient may be used.

provenance.paragraph_text: "Acidified buttermilk" is a substitute made by adding a food-grade acid such as vinegar or lemon juice to milk. It can be produced by mixing 1 tablespoon () of acid with 1 cup () of milk and letting it sit until it curdles, about 10 minutes. Any level of fat content for the milk ingredient may be used, but whole milk is usually used for baking. In the process which is used to produce paneer, such acidification is done in the presence of heat.
